title: Customer-led growth | Georgiana Laudi (Forget The Funnel)
key_insights: Focus on understanding your best customers (those who get value, pay, are happy, and remember life before your product) rather than trying to optimize for all users
Traditional funnels fail because they put businesses at the center instead of customers and don't account for post-acquisition retention and expansion
Map customer journeys through struggle, evaluation, and growth phases with measurable KPIs for each milestone
Better qualified customers from improved messaging can increase trial-to-paid conversion even without touching the product experience
Use customer research to identify which product features deliver the most value, then front-load those in onboarding
Jobs-to-be-done focuses on what customers are trying to accomplish rather than demographic data
Create proactive and reactive customer experiences to help users reach value milestones and catch them when they fall off
Voice-of-customer research can be done efficiently in 2-3 weeks with surveys, avoiding analysis paralysis

guest_background.current_role: Co-founder of Forget The Funnel consultancy

topics_discussed: Problems with traditional marketing funnels and pirate metrics
Customer journey mapping from struggle to growth phases
Identifying and prioritizing ideal customer segments
Setting KPIs for customer journey milestones
Conversion rate optimization through better customer fit
memorable_quotes: The problem with funnels and pirate metrics... is that nobody knows what those mean. It puts every customer in the same sort of buckets. It assumes that all customers and all products are the same.
You want to reflect them back to them. That is what is going to show them that you understand the problem that they have and that your product has exactly what it is that they need.
We often talk about it and describe it as the story of how I met and fell in love with your product.
summary: Georgiana Laudi shares her systematic approach to customer-led growth, demonstrating how deep customer research and journey mapping can unlock significant conversion improvements. She provides a practical framework for understanding your best customers and optimizing their experience from problem recognition through product adoption and expansion.
